intro: Deinbollia pycnophylla, commonly known as the dense-leaved bignon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves that are often arranged in a compact, bushy form. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
